result.execSummary:
The defendant Jessy L Hanson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
No possession of dangerous weapons. 

Absolute sobriety from controlled substances unless prescribed and taken as prescribed.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.   AODA and follow up. 

DNA sample.  

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jessy L Hanson

22CM672;
State moves to;

CT 2>>DRI.

PLEA: 
CT 1 (Possession of Cocaine/Coca - Repeater)>>NO CONTEST.

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, defendant is competent to represent self: a factual basis & defendant guilty;

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 1 year probation; CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent; AODA and follow up; No possession of dangerous weapons; Absolute sobriety from controlled substances unless prescribed and taken as prescribed; CC plus DNA surcharge; DNA sample.

Intake Report- Marathon County Pretrial Services

No contact with victim(s): Co-Defendant: M.N. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.   Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.  No possession of drug paraphernalia.   Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons during the pendency of this action. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (2) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
